Thank me later :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2094688"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2094688#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2093872" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2093872" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cloelles"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388054"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1388054.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cloelles" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Granado/Bossa-63970.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63970.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bossa"title="Bossa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2093872ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2093872" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388054">Cloelles</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-15">03/15/24 18:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Maybe I'm crazy but I smell banana.. perhaps banana bread but less sweet.. very nice and smooth, sexy, for the evening. Not in your face but more gentle and understated. Gourmand without the typical sweetness. Clear winner of all the Penhaligon's that I have tested (about 20 of them). Leans femme. Very impressive, I will keep testing this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2093872"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2093872#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2083974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2083974" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bobdasha28"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816909"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bobdasha28" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2083974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2083974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816909">Bobdasha28</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-06">03/06/24 07:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have this perfume and fell in love from the first sniff. It’s a simple, cold caramel scent, with some depth of the tobacco and spicy comfort from the cardamom. It’s not like a gourmand type caramel but a soft, cool type that doesn’t stick at the back of your throat, possibly from the cardamon as it cools the scent down (if that makes sense). The only issue I had with scent is that it doesn’t last long and has not projection which is so sad. It only lasts a maximum of an hour on my skin and clothes. For a Penhaligons perfume, I would have thought it would last longer as I have even their colognes which last much longer than this. I would recommend testing it on your skin before purchasing. I feel also for the price it probably not worth it but the caramel is very beautiful😮💨♥️</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2083974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2083974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078143" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2061159" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cuddlyavocado"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015325"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cuddlyavocado" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2061159ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2061159" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2015325">cuddlyavocado</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-13">02/13/24 12:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted this perfume ever since I have read it's description. So I decided to buy it blindly.<br />
Let me start with a positive.. It is a gorgeous scent but not what I imagined based on the notes. To me it smells like if Coca Cola was making a spicy version of their soda which I love but was definitely different from what I expected. I spray it on as I work to make myself enjoy the moment.<br />
<br />
I am pretty sure that I will go through the bottle before summer simply because longevity of the scent is an hour maximum. And even after application projection is very intimate.<br />
<br />
I do love the mist spray though.<br />
<br />
With this perfume you would need to carry a bottle around with you or just use it at home. No one but you will know you have it on anyway.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2061159"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2061159#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2058865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2058865" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maya lilac"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705079"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1705079.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maya lilac" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2058865ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2058865" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705079">Maya lilac</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-11">02/11/24 05:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I have just discovered my favourite caramel scent. It’s so unique, different type of caramel that I  am used to smell in perfume!<br />
<br />
I attribute this uniqueness to the pimento note, because caramel mixed with cardamom, vanilla, cashmeran and tobacco is frequently used and I am sure I have got a few fragrances like that. I also have fragrances with vanilla and salt combined so don’t think it’s that either.<br />
<br />
Either way, this smells so delicious, gourmand and addictive that I can’t wait to get it to my collection. <br />
<br />
It’s not performing well and it’s super pricey, so I have to wait for a good deal. But I have to have Changing Constance.<br />
<br />
I have two decants of Minuit et Demi and these two scents are indeed similar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2058865"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2058865#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2056327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2055121" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hola gigi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379381"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1379381.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hola gigi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Snif/Tart-Deco-81969.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81969.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tart Deco"title="Tart Deco"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2055121ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2055121" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379381">hola gigi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-07">02/07/24 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The spices are much fainter than I'd expected based on the notes. Not a great performer. The opening gives the same type of caramel vibe as Jo Malone Ginger Biscuit. I don't experience any of the pimento note or tobacco accords. I think it's underwhelming &amp; overpriced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2055121"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2055121#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2039234" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2039234" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sniffathon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357164"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1357164.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sniffathon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2039234ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2039234" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357164">Sniffathon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-23">01/23/24 02:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WHY OH WHY is this so spectacular and such a let down at the same time???<br />
I really wonder what the design brief was when Penhaligon’s decided to release this the way it is. <br />
On one hand this is one of the best caramel based, grown up gourmand fragrances I’ve ever gotten my nose on. <br />
On the other hand, no amount of sprays can amplify its TERRIBLE performance. It lasts almost as long as a fart. 40 sprays deep, with a top up 30 minutes later, and I still really have to concentrate to find the scent on my skin and clothes. <br />
I managed to score this second hand at less than half the retail price. And I am still going to on-sell it because it is such a pointless bottle of juice. Even wearing it to bed is not bringing me any joy after the first 5 minutes.<br />
<br />
EDIT - I blind bought Navitus Raised Spirits and my itch for this fragrance has now been satisfied!!! Do yourself a favour and find a sample.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2039234"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2039234#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2032937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2032937" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jillvee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750980"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1750980.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jillvee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Black-Vanilla-46662.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46662.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Vanilla"title="Black Vanilla"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2032937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2032937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1750980">jillvee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-16">01/16/24 15:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a sweet. warm and close wearing gourmand. Caramel and vanilla are the stars of the show with a tiny hint of spice from the cardamom. I personally don't get the pimento, salt or tobacco. the cashmeran smooths out the vanilla and caramel to have it lean a tiny more towards a cozier skin scent than an overly sweet bakery. It's a nice enough fragrance but I don't get a lot of projection or longevity and this is quite expensive. I'll enjoy my decant but I didn't personally think this stood miles beyond other vanilla gourmands that are currently out there.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2032937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2032937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2012146" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2012146" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Elysiom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1441213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Elysiom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Twilly-d-Hermes-Eau-Ginger-67667.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67667.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Twilly d'Hermès Eau Ginger"title="Twilly d'Hermès Eau Ginger"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2012146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2012146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1441213">Elysiom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-27">12/27/23 10:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's a complicated scent, I see now why it's so highly rated.  First time I tried it, I took the caramel at face value and didn't try further.  After coming back and really letting it dry down, you can see the complexity to the formulation.  I've compared it to Bouquet Ideale and Babylon and neither are close- there is something really comforting and smooth in the drydown, but not sweet.  It's that little hint of cashmere and salt that rounds it out- the caramel with the hint of spice is what draws you in at first but the scent profile is so smooth.  Huh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2012146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2012146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008860" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2008860" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smelling.sniffing.swan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1892188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smelling.sniffing.swan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2008860ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2008860" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188">smelling.sniffing.swan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-23">12/23/23 10:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For those that love caramel... not me<br />
Like a cake so sweet that eating it gives you heartburn.<br />
Marshmallow, Vanilla. Too gourmand.<br />
Definitely will be someone's cup of tea, but i just find this level of thick, creamy, sweetness nauseating.<br />
<br />
Brought back a memory of a school friend that used to coat herself in Katy Perry's 'Mad Potion'.<br />
Strikingly similar.<br />
<br />
Un-smoked tobacco at the bottom, but nowhere near enough of it to keep the sugar grounded.<br />
<br />
Simple profile and linear development on skin.<br />
<br />
VERDICT: Medium to high possibility that I am now diabetic. <br />
A wash off.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2008860"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2008860#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2004292" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2004292" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Smeraldina77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1613700"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Smeraldina77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Magenta-Tanzanite-71536.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71536.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Magenta Tanzanite"title="Magenta Tanzanite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2004292ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2004292" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1613700">Smeraldina77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-18">12/18/23 08:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well, it is a nice scent, although nothing groundbreaking.<br />
The real problem here is the longevity, in my opinion.<br />
After a couple of hours neither my husband nor I were able to smell anything... I do not care much about projection, but I would like to be able to smell my own scent a little longer than two hours, especially for this price.<br />
I have Magenta Tanzanite which is very similar, very overpriced as well, but I like it much better, and lasts a decent time.<br />
I have the discovery set of Penhaligon's Portraits Gallery, so far I tried only The Bewitching Yasmine and Changing Constance and I find that Yasmine is so much better (I actually like it a lot).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2004292"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2004292#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2000387" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2000387" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LALDN"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302512"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1302512.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LALDN" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Pulp-3576.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3576.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pulp"title="Pulp"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2000387ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2000387" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302512">LALDN</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-13">12/13/23 13:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you like soft warm slightly spicy vanilla’s then this is for you. It’s my go to fall/winter scent for when I can’t choose, because it’s comforting and not too strong. Teddy Graham’s but elevated is accurate. It hits well, is balanced and not a screamer. If you like strong and ever present scents then this isn’t for you. Personally, it’s a favorite of mine that I never grow tired of. Appropriate for the every day and layers well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="2000387"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=2000387#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997630" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Unisex leaning on feminine - I usually prefer strictly feminine scents but I really like this one. Unfortunately, the lasting power is disappointing, especially for the price point. Probably won't buy a full bottle because of that :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1997062"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1997062#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1993360" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993360" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="babypong"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869030"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1869030.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="babypong" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sol-de-Janeiro/Cheirosa-62-56062.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56062.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cheirosa '62"title="Cheirosa '62"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993360ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993360" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1869030">babypong</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-05">12/05/23 14:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i mostly smell cardamom and vanilla in this. The smell is good, almost unisex. Just really dissapointed with the silage and lasting. It has really weak silage and I can only get 2-3 hours before I need to reapply. Reminds me a little of Maison Kurkdjian petit matin. I am unimpressed with both scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1993360"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1993360#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1992843" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1992843" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rosiewebber"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rosiewebber" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1992843ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1992843" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480732">Rosiewebber</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-05">12/05/23 03:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening is a big dose of cardamom, the first few seconds of which are oddly sour. But then it blends with cashmeran and tobacco, and just a hint of salt. As it dries down the caramel becomes prominent, and the cardamom disappears. <br />
It’s very nice actually, though I find it a little masculine for my taste (which usually just means it’s solidly unisex), and it does sit a bit too close to the skin. It’s warm, spicy, and sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1992843"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1992843#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1990970" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; A wonderful kick of pimento that settles into a lovely salted caramel. Mysterious and fun! Port projection though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1990970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1990970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986327" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It’s balanced and subtle but interesting. But then the drydown becomes a boring (to me) caramel scent. I love the first half hour of this fragrance (even a half hour is generous) but as soon as the cardamom and spice fade what’s left is not worth the price tag in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1986327"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1986327#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978542" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978542" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Toyboy38"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1414444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1414444.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Toyboy38" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Papilefiko-74667.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74667.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Papilefiko"title="Papilefiko"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978542ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978542" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1414444">Toyboy38</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-17">11/17/23 00:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Purchased Penhaligon's Portraits Scent Library Discovery Set recently and what a true treasure of a house. After having smelled Constance. It reminded me of a candy. Something I haven't had in more than 20 years. So it took me a while to understand the scent. As it dried down, I got it. It's not an exact match. Not sure if anyone else gets it. <br />
<br />
It reminded me of a cereal I used to binge on when I was little called Golden Grahams.<br />
Lovely scent. I can see this one being someone's signature Winter/Fall or even Spring scent during day or night.<br />
<br />
Definitely not for Summer due to it's heavy and sweet nature. <br />
<br />
For me it's an 8/10 <br />
I appreciate the scent, but also recognise it's not for me.<br />
<br />
To my nose it's unisex but a subtle nudge leaning masculine. But both men or women can easily pull it off even though it's made for women.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1978542"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1978542#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1975202" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1975202" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pale-cinder"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1586359"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1586359.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pale-cinder" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Apple-Brandy-on-the-Rocks-68326.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68326.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Apple Brandy on the Rocks"title="Apple Brandy on the Rocks"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1975202ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1975202" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1586359">pale-cinder</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-12">11/12/23 18:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, balanced salty caramel. It’s a very nice and pretty fragrance for fall day time. I don’t pick up pimento notes but I do feel a little bit of smokiness coming from tabacco. Unfortunately it has a weak projection and not long-lasting for the price. It’s good but I would not buy a full bottle, I’ve received a sample with another parfum from the Penhaligon's house.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1975202"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1975202#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972825" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1972825" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zori"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1558485"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1558485.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zori" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Amore-Caffe-87409.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87409.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amore Caffè"title="Amore Caffè"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1972825ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1972825" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1558485">zori</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 16:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought it today and I already have so much to say. To begin with, to me the most accurate and spot on description of this perfume is that it’s the baby of Hypnotic poison EDT by Dior and Jazz club by Replica. If you wish Jazz club was more famine, definitely get this one. <br />
<br />
I wore it today for the first time and my boyfriend LOVED it. But wait, he was sick and wearing a face mask the whole time and the first thing he commented on was my perfume. He got so obsessed with it. He kept talking about it the entire night which he never does. This perfume had him under a spell.<br />
<br />
I’ll update my review when I get more wear out of it, but so far, I’m so in love with it. It’s so perfect. (Performance might not be great but I’m still testing that).<br />
<br />
Also, if you like the tobacco in this one but you want something more day-time, I recommend you try out Ma’Alaina by Nabeel.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1972825"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1972825#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1971474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1886882">Soudz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-08">11/08/23 01:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love the smell , But i really regret buying it for 890AED (240$) people don't even notice the scent unless they attached to my skin, its very very over priced i regret buying it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1971474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1971474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1970826" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1970826" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mr. Melk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1573004"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1573004.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mr. Melk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jacques-Fath/Vetiver-Gris-74683.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74683.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vetiver Gris"title="Vetiver Gris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1970826ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1970826" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1573004">Mr. Melk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-07">11/07/23 07:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you want a weaker and much less balsamic lune feline, this is for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1970826"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1970826#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1956069" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1956069" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="marietangerine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463786"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1463786.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="marietangerine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Al-Haramain-Perfumes/Amber-Oud-Rouge-66100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Amber Oud Rouge"title="Amber Oud Rouge"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1956069ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1956069" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463786">marietangerine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-19">10/19/23 11:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is very yummy and pretty. It is what I was hoping Atelier des Ors Lune Feline would be. Strong salted caramel cardamom notes. I find the cardamom fades fairly quickly, and sadly the projection and longevity are not great. If you can find this on a steep discount I would say it is worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1956069"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1956069#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1952072" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1952072" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amnebe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1645213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1645213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amnebe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Floral-Street/Wild-Vanilla-Orchid-47212.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47212.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wild Vanilla Orchid"title="Wild Vanilla Orchid"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1952072ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1952072" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1645213">amnebe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-14">10/14/23 19:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was blown over by the opening of this scent which was pure cardamom. I would have been happy for it to stay there, but it quickly turned into warm vanilla and apple pie with the cardamom notes starting to disappear. Soon, it started reminding me of  La Vie Est Belle. However, it's softer and less cloying and replaces sweet tobacco notes for LVEB's patchouli, so it's not going to make you sick of it by the end of the day. Unfortunately, it doesn't last a long time. When a perfume costs over $300 per bottle, you don't want it to fade into the background so quickly. <br />
<br />
Edit: So, now I understand why it's called Changing Constance. I tried this again on a cold, rainy day, and the cardamom note stays much longer, and it doesn't remind me of LVEB at all. It starts off mainly as a warm, cozy cardamom cookie gourmand. Oddly, at about the hour mark, the scent bubble around me smells more like Light Blue, and when I get closer to sniff it on my wrist, my wrists just smell sweet, but it has almost completely evaporated. I don't understand the shift between smelling like a warm and toasty gourmand and a summertime airy fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1952072"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1952072#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1949660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
