padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1948249" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cottonpuff_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1294541"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1294541.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cottonpuff_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Orchidee-Vanille-6463.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6463.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orchidee Vanille"title="Orchidee Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1948249ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1948249" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1294541">cottonpuff_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-10">10/10/23 02:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is sweet, savory and a bit spicy (in a good way). I've never smelled a gourmand like this! Spicy salted caramel vanilla goodness. Downside is that its is very soft and not long-lasting for the price. <br />
<br />
Layer this with BDK gris charnel, it's amazing for fall and winter!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1948249"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1948249#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1941073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1941073" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="atv315"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33264"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.33264.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="atv315" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Women-818.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.818.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Women"title="Burberry Women"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1941073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1941073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33264">atv315</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-30">09/30/23 10:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wish this were less sweet and more complex, especially at this price point That said, it’s nice and very comforting. I’d wear this on a fall day when I’m wrapped up in a warm blanket reading a good book. It just doesn’t resemble a higher end fragrance at all to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1941073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1941073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1939911" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1939911" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="teenwolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/228863"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.228863.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="teenwolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1939911ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1939911" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/228863">teenwolf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-28">09/28/23 23:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am writing as a male reviewer who owns this perfume. <br />
<br />
Changing Constance is THE Caramel perfume for me, its not overly sickly sweet/overly gourmand (i'm looking at you Shay &amp; Blue + "What About Pop" The House of Oud +  other Victoria Secret-esque body sprays). The spices involved keeps the scent light and airy and keeps the perfume from leaning too childish or synthetic. Its a grown up scent that evokes nostalgia and festive seasons, some would say this lean feminine but its rather unisex tbh. <br />
<br />
Its a scent that stays rather close to skin, which is what i prefer when it comes to a scent profile like this. Its a perfume for you and your loved ones who will be in your personal bubble. You will get wafts of it as you move around so don't expect this perfume to perform like a Kerosene perfume cuz it won't. A scent that certainly puts a smile on your face!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1939911"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1939911#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1937307" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1937307" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ahmosenefertari"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/636930"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ahmosenefertari" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1937307ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1937307" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/636930">ahmosenefertari</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-25">09/25/23 18:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tested it once and was in love. Then I tested it again and I changed my mind. The slightly saltei caramel and vanilla is so well blended. However, the cardamom and pimento, together at opening, add a note thar (sorry to say this) reminds me the acidic contents of our stomach when we vomit 🤢.  This completly changed my mind about the fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1937307"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1937307#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1925636" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1925636" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fvnaticbychoice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171326"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1171326.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fvnaticbychoice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Bijou-Romantique-14559.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14559.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bijou Romantique"title="Bijou Romantique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1925636ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1925636" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1171326">fvnaticbychoice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-11">09/11/23 17:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is FANTASTIC. smoked caramel goodness with spice. I’m going to see how it layers with the original Bvlgari Omnia.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1925636"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1925636#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1919068" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1919068" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NynkeNyx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1608564"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1608564.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NynkeNyx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-7-Virtues/Cherry-Ambition-87203.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87203.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cherry Ambition"title="Cherry Ambition"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1919068ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1919068" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1608564">NynkeNyx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-03">09/03/23 19:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The only complain I have for this is the longevity and projection for the price tag. That is it because this frag put me in a chokehold the moment I test it at a random airport duty free store. I remember scrolling through and testing all the frag from Penhaligon booth thinking "this isn't it, maybe this house isn't for me". But as soon as my nose hit the test strip for Changing Constance, my eyes shot wide open (my mum saw it and got it for me haha, she know not a lot of frag can pull such a reaction from me. Thanks mum). <br />
<br />
It is not overly sweet, the spices is soft and cozy rather than being too warm and swing it into a winter only frag. I can only describe it as being wrap in a soft cashmere blanket while someone is grinding up the spices for a masala chai. The salt cut out the sweetness without losing the integrity of what this frag supposed to be. It's elegant, nose tickling, addicting but fleeting scent as the spices have this lightness to it that doesn't weight down the imaginary blanket. I can only wish that my skin naturally smell like this 24/7</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1919068"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1919068#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1917028" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1917028" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jessica_chinos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1700820.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jessica_chinos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Versace/Eros-Pour-Femme-Eau-de-Toilette-39355.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39355.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eros Pour Femme Eau de Toilette"title="Eros Pour Femme Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1917028ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1917028" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700820">jessica_chinos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-01">09/01/23 09:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted to check this fragrance out since I fell head over heels in love with Minuit et Demi. Many reviews on MED page said that it was just like Changing Constance... Well, I beg to differ. Changing Constance lasts less on my skin, projects less and lacks the intoxicating and addictive aspect of Minuit et Demi. This fragrance smells good, I like it, but I can't enjoy it getting whiffs of it throughout an evening because it has a MINIMAL projection. I like that it smells like salted caramel and pimento, wonderful combination. But the performance is so incredibly lacking that it's a pass for me. On a side note, this fragrance gave me an allergic reaction, every time I smelled it, I sneezed, that's not common on me since I smell about 4 perfumes a day. <br />
Conclusion: I thought Minuit et Demi had bad performance, but Changing Constance does it even worse. A pass for me, I'll rather save to buy Minuit et Demi for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1917028"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1917028#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1916935" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1916935" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Clairexoxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617341"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1617341.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Clairexoxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1916935ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1916935" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1617341">Clairexoxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-09-01">09/01/23 07:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The best spicy caramel. It’s warm, slightly salty, perfectly spicy from the pimento and cardamom (do not attack the nostril nor make the scent dry). A gourmand that is not sickening or juvenile. Deliciously put together. So well blended and perfectly rounded. <br />
<br />
Sadly the performance is quite underwhelming projection-wise. Longevity is very acceptable on warm clothings, I sprayed 3 times and I can still smell it 24+ hours later. Now the projection however is very intimate and quiet most of the time. It’s not undetectable, even 7 hours post application, I catch adequate whiffs now and then (when being at home). I just wish it was more consistently noticeable given the price. <br />
<br />
I think this is a good cozy up, snuggle up, stay at home, comforting fragrance — if you can afford it. It’s not a beast or attention grabbing one, but for what it is, I’m in love because it smells so good to me! <br />
<br />
I find Prada Candy quite similar although a bit more powdery. Check it out if you’re interested: it’s cheaper and has better performance (it’s not a beast either but the projection is better).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1916935"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1916935#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1914725" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1914725" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maliken"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1598503.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maliken" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1914725ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1914725" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1598503">Maliken</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-29">08/29/23 16:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think this a rather well balanced gourmand that is not too sweet or overbearing with the spices and other heavier accords. It's perhaps a bit too gentle unfortunately, since there's no projection whatsoever and turns into a skin scent within minutes and continues to wither until it disappears entirely in less than 4 hours. Beautiful bottle like all of the others from the collection, but the performance for the price this retails at is unacceptable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1914725"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1914725#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1907879" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473695">HMY</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-21">08/21/23 13:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am so surprised I love it. On dry down it reminds me Lira..its sweet like lemon cake with spicy twist. Its nice gourmand. Like everyone says it does not last or project much but it’s beautiful. The bottle and story behind is great. I got it for great price but not sure I would pay 200£ or whatever for this. Very likely not.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1907879"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1907879#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1904437" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1904437" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bobdasha28"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816909"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bobdasha28" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1904437ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1904437" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816909">Bobdasha28</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-17">08/17/23 08:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice sweet caramel smell with a tobacco like background. A very simple sweet smell but I wouldn’t say it’s something unique like penhaligon’s classical smells. Also it definitely doesn’t last long, maybe it’s because my skin is on the warmer side usually but the projection is definitely not worth it’s price sadly. Really wanted to like it as I have a full bottle (I fell in love with the tester) however after using most of the bottle I came to the conclusion that it just doesn’t last long.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1904437"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1904437#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1882517" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1882517" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cdcs"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188872"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cdcs" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Narcotic-Delight-89368.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89368.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narcotic Delight"title="Narcotic Delight"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1882517ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1882517" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1188872">cdcs</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-19">07/19/23 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Cute, but kind of boring and hardly even there, much less any projection. Not for me and definitely not worth the price for something so light. I mostly get salty caramel, tobacco powder with a hint of the Penhaligon's DNA. Unremarkable, and especially disapointing after being convinced by all the hype it gets online.<br />
Let's see if I change my mind before the end of this decant. If I do, I'll update it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1882517"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1882517#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1881493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It’s like when spray it on clothes after clean it by chlorine I dont like it .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1881493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1881493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1880661" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1880661" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Toasty-shmoes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1687570"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1687570.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Toasty-shmoes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Gold-71608.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71608.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold"title="Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1880661ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1880661" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1687570">Toasty-shmoes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-17">07/17/23 09:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sadly, I found that this fragrance performed quite poorly. Zero sillage and next to no lasting power. I'm a bit shocked! As I prefer intimate scents, I was very surprised when I went anosmic to Changing Constance within five minutes. <br />
<br />
It has a lovely little punch of cardamom when initially sprayed, then the scent quickly dissipates to a lightly caramel scent; I got little to no pimento or tobacco. If you are looking for a sweet gourmand with a nice kick of cardamom and spices, go with Gilded Fox by Pinrose. Longevity is infinitely better and the sent profile is quite similar (also only costs $90 for 50ml as apposed to $310 for 75ml).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1856481" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherubina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1314162"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1314162.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherubina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1856481ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1856481" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); Subtle fragrance that doesn't have silage. Like you are wearing a fragrance but no one else can tell. Tested it many times i wanted to know what is smells like but i couldn't tell it was that weak, gentle misty almost undetectable.<br />
<br />
Changing Constance is a rip of :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1856481"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1856481#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1846837" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1846837" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="feuermaiden"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1684821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1684821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="feuermaiden" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boy-Smells/Woodphoria-75837.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75837.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Woodphoria"title="Woodphoria"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1846837ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1846837" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1684821">feuermaiden</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-01">06/01/23 16:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I actually like this scent quite a lot, but I still can’t decide if I want to spend the money on a full bottle. <br />
<br />
Immediately it’s very warm and the cardamom comes out, followed by the salty caramel which, to me, is really prominent. I also get a lot of powdery-ness. <br />
<br />
Typically I like a good dose of woodiness and smokiness to balance out the sweetness in these types of fragrances, and this is all sweet and slightly aromatic to my nose. <br />
<br />
I’m undecided, but leaning heavily towards the positive side. This would be very cozy in the winter and fall.<br />
<br />
Edit: After wear testing it again, I’m not sold. It lasts all of 2 seconds on the skin and there are much better fragrances in this vein for the price. Passing on Constance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1846837"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1846837#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1839141" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's sweet without cloying, actually it translates rather fresh on my skin. It's giving amber vibes but I suppose this is the tobacco. Love the salty twist. Very likeable and easy to pull off IMO</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1839141"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1839141#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1837529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Fantastic blend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1837529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1837529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1827627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Vanilla adds some softness here. Leans feminine to me, but I can imagine men wearing it as well. Intoxicating. The silage is beastly on me. Lasts 12+ hours. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1826362" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="adrianaiyo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193029"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1193029.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="adrianaiyo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1826362ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1826362" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193029">adrianaiyo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-06">05/06/23 10:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a good one.<br />
Strong tobacco, whisky, salt and caramel. <br />
Tho longevity is really bad. It lasts only 1-2hrs.<br />
Sillage pretty Ok, given that its notes, better not to be too strong like Hysteria.<br />
A not very feminine female perfume, it portraits an adventurous lady who shove off the typical female attire just like Constance. It's more a unisex perfume imo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1826362"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1826362#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1823924" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1437566">Spicy89</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-03">05/03/23 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The smell is sooo cozy!<br />
The Longevity is about 6-7 hours, but the projection and sillage is low, this is a perfume for the person who wears it. You get faint wiffs of it as you move through out the day. <br />
So if you're NOT looking for an attention grabbing loud perfume, this might be for you!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1823924"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1823924#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1821114" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I love this scent and how it develops on my skin. To complete it and increase the lasting power I layer it with the roll-on version of Royal Gold by El Nabil. Chef's kiss!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1816893"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1816893#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1787552" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1787552" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1787552ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1787552" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-19">03/19/23 15:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an extremely nice scent, a springtime version of Halfeti, but frankly the original is not worth the £215 price tag due to its poor sillage and longevity.<br />
<br />
I do not usually like vanilla in perfumes unless they are well-blended, and here it offers a warm and comforting accord to the fresh green notes of cardamom. I smell gingerbread cookies as well. But over 200 quid for a skin scent??<br />
I bought a £20 dupe from Scent U.K. to see if it has better sillage. It projects moderately compared to the original.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1787552"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1787552#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1785407" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1785407" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MysticalArugula"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1703303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MysticalArugula" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1785407ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1785407" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1703303">MysticalArugula</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-16">03/16/23 20:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Okay I was trying to understand the rave of this perfume- like I get it's gourmand and but each time I smell it, it feels damp and sour- and even worse on my skin. You do get the initial caramel sweetness but then it smells as if you got out to a sweaty club. Like I could see this fragrance is a wannabe popular girl trying to be like her cousin Yasmine. Not a fan at least not for me- Britney spears does a way better job with Midnight Fantasy at this point. <br />
<br />
Zodiac Trio<br />
⬆️Virgo ☀️Leo 🌜Aries</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1785407"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1785407#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1783007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1783007" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vics"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1166792"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vics" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tiziana-Terenzi/Chiron-66357.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66357.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chiron"title="Chiron"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1783007ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1783007" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1166792">Vics</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-14">03/14/23 02:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this fragrance so much. It's sweet, caramel, a little spicy and I get vanilla. Everything I like, but...it just doesn't last very long. I bought a sample of the fragrance before a full bottle and this seemed to last on my skin much better, I don't know why though. I bought a full bottle because I love it so much but I'm going to save it for intimate moments when there is nose to skin contact because it really is a beautiful fragrance, and if I can't smell it then hopefully who I'm with will appreciate it! <br />
For a bigger hitting perfume I'll wear By The Fireplace. It's much more smoky at the start than Changing Constance but it develops to a similar base, just more lasting and projecting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1783007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1783007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1778103" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1778103" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ph440_"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1692619"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1692619.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ph440_" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Calvin-Klein/Eternity-257.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.257.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eternity"title="Eternity"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1778103ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1778103" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1692619">ph440_</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-08">03/08/23 05:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>WOAH!!! Changing Constance really lives up to her name with the way this frag develops over time &lt;3 absolutely stunning!!! on the first spray the cardamom really stands out but not overwhelmingly so, but very soon dries down to a smooth, buttery caramel and then a soft vanilla! however, i think Constance, like most other frags from Penhaligon is really a skin scent :( i didn't get much projection at all and after about 2 hours i can only smell her with my nose pretty much to my wrist unfortunately... <br />
<br />
i don't see myself investing in a full bottle at all (especially given the hefty price point) but she is a very pretty scent... i would only recommend her if you're willing to constantly respray or you're looking for a frag purely for your own enjoyment and don't want anyone to smell her but you!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1762629" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amanda0727"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1583049"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="amanda0727" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Guidance-78656.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78656.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Guidance"title="Guidance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1762629ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1762629" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1583049">amanda0727</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-17">02/17/23 14:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow love at first sniff! I thought the opening was going to be a punch in the face with the cardamom and pepper but not at all! It was quite a mild cardamom and pepper. Then the salt caramel quickly comes thru and it dries down to a sweet vanilla smoothed out by the cashmeran. I can see why some say it is similar to Kilian Princess but I see maybe 10% similarity in that they are sweet. Princess is marshmallow-y green tea and a lighter, airier sweetness while this is a caramel heavy sweetness more suitable for fall/winter cold weather. And I must say I love the packaging. One of my favorite bottles in my collection!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1762629"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1762629#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1762468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Reminds me of Initio's Side Effect. I prefer this even though the longevity is not so great. But that's ok. Love it anyways</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1752794"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1752794#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1749609" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1749609" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cherry_Darling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1003821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cherry_Darling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pascal-Morabito/Perle-Pour-Elle-47506.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47506.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Perle Pour Elle"title="Perle Pour Elle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1749609ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1749609" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003821">Cherry_Darling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-02">02/02/23 03:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is great, smooth, gourmand, chai spicy a little but more sweet and less spicy than a chai frag. I'm not huge on caramel but adore cardamom and pepper so if i were to create this perfume I'd make those two shine, however I can understand this may sell better as it is less spicy and more wearable for the everyday wearer. Lovely scent - not too bombastic in projection more of a subtle, almost milky gourmand scent. The caramel and salt are there but all mixing together smoothly nothing really stands out. I'm not smelling any tobacco.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1749609"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1749609#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1742289" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1742289" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavenderdeerling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1656621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1656621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavenderdeerling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1742289ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1742289" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1656621">lavenderdeerling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-24">01/24/23 12:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ah, I sampled this, used up the sample, bought a travel spray on eBay, sprayed it a few times and said "f it, I need a bottle." And bought one. I will admit that the Portraits collection stood out to me because of the bottles and the theming. <br />
<br />
However, I've tested many of them and at the very least liked all of them- Changing Constance is such a velvety soft feminine fragrance while being very unique. I made the mistake of wearing this while watching a new show that I fell for, and now the smell reminds me of the main character, so I inadvertently created a wonderful scent association. (It's Cornelia in "The English")<br />
<br />
Now, to talk about the scent, it's got that smooth almost fruity spice quality that cardamom has, along with a twinge or caramel brown sweetness to round it out, along with the cashmere and the tobacco to keep it far away from gourmand territory. I will admit I have no prior experience with a pimento note so I suspect it is doing a lot to make the scent more unique than I am able to articulate. At first, I found the perfume to be a bit too faint for my liking, but I chalk it up to the fact that many of the other perfumes I wear are very "loud," and I'm curious if that is the issue others are having. Now that I wear it very often, I find it lasts on my skin and clothes all through the night and into the morning! It's a very velvety and soft fragrance.<br />
<br />
Oddly enough, I've found that my bottle, upon testing, has the cardamom noticeably more prominent, as well as almost having a bit of an incensey quality to it that the sample and travel spray didn't (they were a bit more sugary and almost fruity). I don't dislike it, and I am curious if it has to do with aging, as I believe the sample and travel spray are significantly older in comparison to the new bottle. I'm curious to see if it sweetens up with time. I think this is worth mentioning because it was definitely noticeable to me. Not sure if it's due to aging or the spraying mechanism. They are still absolutely recognizable and I think the bottle version will grow on me.<br />
<br />
I think price-wise these perfumes are something I would balk at 2 years ago, but I will admit I have been more into indie perfume oils and have grown tired of them and been wanting something more sophisticated, and have been selling my collection to upgrade to a few precious "fancy" bottles, and I do think it is worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1742289"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1742289#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1740527" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1740527" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CoCo77"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1547963"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1547963.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CoCo77" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kyse-Perfumes/Frangipane-al-Pistacchio-67402.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67402.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Frangipane al Pistacchio"title="Frangipane al Pistacchio"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1740527ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1740527" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1547963">CoCo77</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-22">01/22/23 08:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The name Changing Constance grabbed me, as my name is Connie, and I could just see this antelope-adorned bottle on my perfume tray! On first test months ago, Constance was in my top five; but upon retesting today she gives way to more satisfying, less expensive offerings I've discovered. ($300+ for just 75ml.) This 2018 eau de parfum's pimento top, caramel heart, and tobacco base intrigue me but are overridden by a jarring cardamom note.✿<br />
<br />
Scent family: Amber Vanilla<br />
Longevity on me: moderate</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1740527"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1740527#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1733798" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
