padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1728374" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mother Nurgle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1177401"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1177401.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mother Nurgle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zoologist-Perfumes/Harvest-Mouse-78580.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78580.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Harvest Mouse"title="Harvest Mouse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1728374ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1728374" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1177401">Mother Nurgle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-08">01/08/23 03:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first seven minutes are to die for! I swear I smell something resembling fir. Perhaps it’s the cardemom and pimento teaming up and playing with my senses. But then it’s gone and I’m left with a very sweet gourmand skin scent. It’s pleasant, but not worth the price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1728374"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1728374#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1724455" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1724455" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maggiezred"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1621031"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="maggiezred" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Billie-Eilish/Eilish-70052.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70052.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eilish"title="Eilish"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1724455ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1724455" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1621031">maggiezred</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-03">01/03/23 18:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was so excited to get this one, but I'm a little disappointed. It's a nice scent, but certainly not something I pick up often or ever. I was definitely hoping for the tobacco to round out the sweetness, but on me it smells extremely sweet and I can only pick up the caramel. Not a bad thing if you are looking for a caramel scent, I wouldn't blind buy with this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1724455"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1724455#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1722852" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1722852" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tooombie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516190"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516190.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tooombie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1722852ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1722852" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516190">tooombie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-01">01/01/23 21:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this perfume but unfortunately its one of those i prefer to just smell then to actually wear. The caramel along with all the pimento and cardamon make the perfume extremely sweet and quite overpowering. <br />
I love smelling it from the bottle but makes me a bit sick when i wear it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1722852"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1722852#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1719888" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's a creamy salted caramel with just a hint of spiciness, and sweet pipe tobacco. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1716287" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jarrid_steel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242708"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1242708.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jarrid_steel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Bleu-de-Chanel-Parfum-49912.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49912.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bleu de Chanel Parfum"title="Bleu de Chanel Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1716287ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1716287" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242708">jarrid_steel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-24">12/24/22 06:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells absolutely gorgeous in the opening. It opens very strong but sadly, fades to basically a skin scent within about 30 minutes to an hour. Maybe the opening just has too much punch? I don't know what it is but I really wish the smell that opens the fragrance, the power and projection lasted longer. For the price, I'd expect it to perform better. I love it but glad I just tested out a sample because I'd be really disappointed if I bought it for almost $400 CAD plus tax only to have it last for an hour each time. <br />
<br />
It does lean a bit feminine to my nose but any confident man can pull it off, too. <br />
<br />
Scent : 8/10<br />
Projection : 4/10<br />
Sillage : 4/10<br />
Longevity : 4/10<br />
Overall : 5/10<br />
<br />
I'd recommend testing it before buying it. You may have a completely different result with the performance. It smells amazing, at least for a little while before fading to the skin scent that I experienced. At the 2 hour mark, I had to really strain to even catch a little whiff of it. So, disappointing... I find the portrait collection to have some of the best smells and most gorgeous bottles but none of them have ever really performed well on my skin except maybe Monsieur Beauregard which is now discontinued.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Spicy slightly sweet smoky caramel. Absolutely heaven in a bottle. Massive downside is how close to the skin it sits and the lasting power.  Pathetic. That being said, I just bought a backup bottle so that I may spray with abandoned.  Too expensive for the abysmal performance, but I’m a sucker for the scent, so what is a girl to do? Seriously bury me in it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1702864"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1702864#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1702556" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1702556" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rinlux"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492596"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1492596.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rinlux" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tauer-Perfumes/Au-Coeur-du-Desert-41053.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41053.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Au Coeur du Désert"title="Au Coeur du Désert"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1702556ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1702556" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1492596">rinlux</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-05">12/05/22 08:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really pretty fragrance, the opening is a slightly spicy caramel, which mellows out into a sweet salted caramel scent. The drydown is one of my favorites, with the salted caramel notes mingling with a mellow vanilla. Really nice scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1702556"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1702556#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1701273" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1701273" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rcates78"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343852"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1343852.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rcates78" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tommy-Hilfiger/Tommy-Girl-3016.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3016.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tommy Girl"title="Tommy Girl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1701273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1701273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1343852">Rcates78</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-03">12/03/22 09:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Constance smells like Yasmine without the astringent undertow.  Caramel, cardamom, vanilla...I don't detect any of the things that would give backbone (pimiento, salt, tobacco).  Yasmine and Constance are not different enough from one another to warrant collecting both.  Just take your pick, depending on your preference.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1701273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1701273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1697194" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; At first when I smelled it on a testing strip, I just couldn’t appreciate it. But I went ahead and tried it on myself anyways. After it developed a bit, I fell in love. Nice and warm; not overpowering at all. It really is one of my favorite fragrances; however, it doesn’t last nearly as long as I’d like. If I’m leaving the house for the day, it’s not one I reach for. That’s really disappointing because it is not inexpensive. It’s one of my favorites to wear to bed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1697194"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1697194#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1695611" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1677333"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1677333#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1669141" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1669141" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gafew"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="gafew" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lorenzo-Pazzaglia/Van-Py-Rhum-74243.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74243.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Van Py Rhum"title="Van Py Rhum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1669141ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1669141" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1180551">gafew</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-18">10/18/22 19:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was the first perfume that introduced me into the niche world and I could never forget it. It's got its Penhaligon's DNA (I myself call it noble or aristocrat of some sorts) combined with its own salted caramel, vanilla and cashmeran notes. I always get compliments wearing this though it doesn't radiate very far. My only issue with it is that heat butchers this perfume. I remembered getting it in the UK and it did last for days on clothes! However, when coming back to Thailand (30-40+ degree celcius and super humid), it barely lasts. I have to be super careful with my environment before choosing it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1669141"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1669141#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1665632" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1665632" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rosemary14"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1146250"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1146250.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rosemary14" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sol-de-Janeiro/Cheirosa-59-88722.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88722.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cheirosa '59"title="Cheirosa '59"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1665632ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1665632" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1146250">Rosemary14</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-13">10/13/22 21:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don’t know if I got a bad sample or what but I’m having a hard time smelling this. I’ve become somewhat of a salted caramel fiend and this one is at the bottom of the list for me. There are just too many better scents then this “Weak Constance.” There’s HoO What About Pop, Shay and Blue Salt Caramel, Bon Bon Couture, Chierosa ‘71…. all better than this one imo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454533">Yoliyol</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-09-23">09/23/22 04:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smelt this in the Penhaligon's store and I couldn't leave without getting a bottle but I regret it. Changing constance smells beautiful - like eating a salted caramel candy while walking through an English market during autumn/Christmas wearing a warm cashmere sweater with a vanilla latte in your hand and catching whiffs of the spices from nearby stands in the wind.  But the performance is horrible - for the price point there really isn't an excuse. I've tried layering it with other scents in my collection and they overpower Constance easily.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1651089"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1651089#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1641622" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
This can only be my bed time scent period.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1633476"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1633476#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1631025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1631025" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CR95"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516766.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CR95" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Twilly-d-Hermes-Eau-Ginger-67667.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67667.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Twilly d'Hermès Eau Ginger"title="Twilly d'Hermès Eau Ginger"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1631025ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1631025" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516766">CR95</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-25">08/25/22 07:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It makes me think of a soft cashmere jumper. It's wintery, warm and sweet. Caramel and cardamon embrace. It could last longer for the price but it's not too bad.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1631025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1631025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1614897" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1614897" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RegalKitten"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1519960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="RegalKitten" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1614897ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1614897" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1519960">RegalKitten</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-01">08/01/22 13:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This sounds like it should be my kind of perfume but...I'm almost completely anosmic to it. I've tried it in a Penhaligon's shop and a duty free shop and I can smell any other perfume but not this one. I detect faint caramel for just a moment if I smell the nozzle, but when I spray it on myself or a test strip, then all I can smell is alcohol, followed by nothingness. I am also anosmic to BR540, in case that's relevant (all I can smell in that is disinfectant). I can smell other perfumes just fine after testing these, so it can't just be general olfactory fatigue from smelling too many fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1614897"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1614897#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1601691" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1600600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1600600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1597756" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1597756" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BAF85"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1507166"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1507166.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BAF85" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1597756ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1597756" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1507166">BAF85</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-06">07/06/22 10:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>“I want it, I want it, I want it!!” Testing a decant, and that was my immediate reaction. If you like spicy/warm/sweet fragrances, I can’t imagine you won’t like this! Only gripe I have is that the cardamom and pimento notes don’t stick around longer, because that opening really did make me go, “Christmas!” in my head. <br />
<br />
The drydown is quite sweet, so be forewarned, but it’s lovely, the gourmand-loving child in me adores it. You definitely get the caramel/vanilla overtop a warm pipe tobacco. Absolutely a cold weather scent, I am so getting a bottle of this for the fall! Beautiful and comforting, like drinking a hot cup of a sweet, spiced drink when you’re cold. Definitely up to Penhaligon’s quality level, and the bottle is perfect for what’s inside!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1597756"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1597756#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1591140" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1591140" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="likesleet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510132"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1510132.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="likesleet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/HUNQ/004-Lifeguard-69630.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69630.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="#004 Lifeguard"title="#004 Lifeguard"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1591140ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1591140" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1510132">likesleet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-25">06/25/22 08:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this smelled like nothing to me. just thick spices but in an unappealing way. i only get christmas in the sense of the chimney that santa crawls down, no warm spicy caramel or anything like that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1591140"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1591140#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1591119" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1591119" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="seliko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1373236"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1373236.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="seliko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1591119ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1591119" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1373236">seliko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-25">06/25/22 07:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>now, this is my first time encountering certain notes: cardamom, pimento and tobacco in the same fragrance ?! i was so sure all these notes that are brand new to me would be challenging to my nose. <br />
<br />
i go to a perfume counter to try the famous Halfeti. the lady who assists me there asks me to try one spray of Changing Constance. i remember seeing this fragrance, i’m intrigued. i catch a glimpse of the bottle, very beautiful from up close. the fragrance spreading in the air already indicates what’s coming and i am excited, i bring my wrist to my nose to smell it... and i forget all the other fragrances i have tested that day. <br />
on my mind is this sweet fragrance, not sticky, not sugary, yet sweet and… aromatic? a different dna, my first time with a fragrance of this sort, yet so pleasant to me. i wanted to grab a bottle immediately. i wanted to be the person to wear this captivating fragrance. in my mind i was already wandering around, walking in the street, my scarf around my neck and my friends around me, telling me i smell really good, a beautiful cloudy day…catching the eyes of my coup de coeur as he thinks i’m the most captivating girl he has ever met… <br />
<br />
anyways, i remember it’s the beginning of summer and i am in an airport, i check the price tag, i think it’s deserved somehow if you can justify capitalism, and i put it back. i am still a college student !</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1591119"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1591119#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1574027" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1574027" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jenla"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379281"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1379281.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jenla" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Eden-Sparkling-Lychee-39-Eau-de-Parfum-88197.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88197.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eden Sparkling Lychee | 39 Eau de Parfum"title="Eden Sparkling Lychee | 39 Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1574027ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1574027" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379281">Jenla</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-30">05/30/22 09:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is Christmas in a bottle to me. Sweet but not too sweet, comforting, and warm. Very sophisticated. It also lasts on anything for days whether that be clothing, a piece of card, or skin (even after showering!). The quality of this fragrance is truly unmatched in my opinion. <br />
<br />
The bottle is also gorgeous, if you’re a perfume collector it really looks nice displayed. Very expensive looking and feeling (as you’d expect, because it is!). <br />
<br />
<br />
Scent: 10/10<br />
Projection: 10/10<br />
Longevity: 10/10<br />
Versatility: 6/10 (it’s definitely more of a winter/purely special occasion fragrance)<br />
Price (at full price): 5/10<br />
<br />
Overall: 8.2/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1574027"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1574027#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1572627" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1572627" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kaylovely"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1329847.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kaylovely" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexandre-J/Zafeer-Oud-Vanille-22361.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.22361.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Zafeer Oud Vanille"title="Zafeer Oud Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1572627ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1572627" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1329847">Kaylovely</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-28">05/28/22 05:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Can't find a sample so I'm going to test Minut et Demi for now. If anyone knows where to buy a sample, let me know please and thank you in advance!<br />
I'm seeing alot about performance. I find Halfeti to be absolutely breathtaking but a skin scent. I would opt for B683 ext instead. For this, I guess another option is Minut. Again I haven't tested both to know. I will definitely update once I do!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1572627"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1572627#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1566070" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1566070" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Celestya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251713"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1251713.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Celestya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Margot-Tita/Week-End-au-Ferret-91823.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91823.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Week-End au Ferret"title="Week-End au Ferret"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1566070ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1566070" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251713">Celestya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-17">05/17/22 22:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet, warm, spicy, for caramel lovers. Very well blended, not too sweet. Just perfect for cold and rainy day. Caramel is the star but Cardamon is also very present. The main problem? Longevity and sillage.<br />
8/10<br />
<br />
For winter, for myself, in this brand: Yasmine (cardamon, vanilla, coffee) &gt; Constance (caramel &amp; cardamon) &gt; Duke (rose, wood, pepper).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1566070"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1566070#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1564487" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1564487" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Baroqu3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1265782"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1265782.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Baroqu3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1564487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1564487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1265782">Baroqu3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-15">05/15/22 12:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I finally understand this perfume: It is like your utterly beautiful ingénue cousin Constance that is so sweet, innocent, charming yet demure and you wish she was not your cousin because…😉. It’s definitely not your great aunt Constance for eg. It’s a whisperer not a screamer tender, sublime, delicate, feminine, sweet and incredibly intoxicating!<br />
<br />
It was love at first sniff!<br />
The caramel is smooth and light unlike any other caramel I have smelled, it’s like it was made from scratch by a master chef at a Michelin restaurant. <br />
<br />
The tobacco is muted and blended so well with the other notes that I barely detected it which is great as I don’t generally enjoy tobacco. I think it’s the cashmeran smoothness that pulls everything together so perfectly. There are absolutely no rough edges, the cardamom is so light and delicious with the intoxicating vanilla! Wow! Real masterpiece! The only way I can describe the lightness of this perfume is that it’s like a silk scarf touching the skin lightly.<br />
<br />
I would recommend a sniff as it’s simply beautiful! <br />
Definitely full bottle worthy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1564487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1564487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1563743" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1563743" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scentine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1210646"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1210646.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scentine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1563743ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1563743" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1210646">scentine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-14">05/14/22 09:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There are few fragrances which have me more conflicted than Changing Constance. I am absolutely in love with how it smells and adore this composition without wanting to change a thing about it. <br />
I think the current votes are somewhat off. To me the caramel and vanilla notes are entirely entangled. It's very hard to separate them. And this perceived saltiness is an aspect of this mix, rather than something that stands out independently. The cardamom is very present throughout. So much so that in my mind it is a cardamom-dominant fragrance and the rest simply gives it a platform. What is way underreported is the pimento note, though. In the very opening it's almost as strong as the cardamom, but begins to fade out as it develops. I think a lot of people just don't recognize it and thus perhaps clump it in as an aspect of the "salt" note? Pimento is hard to describe, but to me it feels like a translucent, peppery veil. It's not nearly as aromatic as black or white pepper for example, but it makes the composition tingly and lively in the opening, and fits in between the saltiness of the caramel, the tobacco in the base and the vaguely oriental spiciness of cardamom. <br />
<br />
Now, here's my issue. If this was just something that happened to me I could perhaps write this off as a personal experience and leave it at that, as my skin is as dry as the Sahara. But as it very clearly is a common occurrence, we need to address the elephant in the room. As beautiful as this fragrance is, the longevity is poor to the point of being offensive. And I do mean shockingly poor, especially given the retail price. It performs much worse than most EdTs I have. The fragrance stays close to the skin from the beginning, and I could probably get a couple of hours out of it at the most. Which is not what any of us are expecting from it, I suspect. I've had a few samples now, all of them from Penhaligon's and as much as I want this, I just struggle to justify the purchase of a full bottle over so many other fragrances that perform like the luxury product that we're paying for and not like a watery body spray.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1563743"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1563743#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1562118" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1562118" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maggs1710"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1502404"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maggs1710" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1562118ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1562118" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1502404">Maggs1710</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-12">05/12/22 03:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely love this scent, the notes are everything but what kills me is the sillage and longevity. It just does not last, the only time it projects is when you spray it! I have body sprays that last longer. £210 is steep for a fleeting scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="50256"comment_id="1562118"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Changing-Constance-50256.html?ccid=1562118#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1557983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1557983" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="buonobi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/23408"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.23408.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="buonobi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Portrayal-Woman-54459.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54459.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Portrayal Woman"title="Portrayal Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1557983ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1557983" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); Spicy Caramel gourmand thing.<br />

<br />
